content.2. Course Description: The student will learn about understanding the basic concepts of food and nutrition, as well as understanding the requirements for energy and nutrients. They will also learn about the integration of the core principles of biological, chemical, and physical sciences associated with the study of food from farm to fork. Additionally, the course will provide an introduction to the global control of food quality and safety.
content.5. Course Main Objectives: This course aims to introduces the field of food science and nutrition, covering topics such as nutrients, their properties, sources, and importance. Gain knowledge of the fundamentals of food science and the underlying technology associated with providing a safe, nutritious, and abundant supply of fresh and processed foods to consumers.

1.0 Knowledge and understanding.Course Learning Outcome: Recognize nutrients' importance, classification, sources, function, and requirements
Outline fundamental aspects of food science.

2.0 Skills.Course Learning Outcome: Explain food preservation principles to achieve high quality products
Evaluate food science current issues and problems and implement principles to assure food quality.

topics.topic:
Introduction to Food Sciences and Nutrition: Overview of the field of food sciences and nutrition Importance of studying food sciences and nutrition
Basic concepts and principles in food sciences and nutrition

Food Composition and Nutritional Analysis:
Understanding the components of food (carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, minerals, etc.)
Techniques for analyzing and evaluating the nutritional content of food Interpretation of food labels and nutritional information

Food Processing and Preservation:
Principles of food processing and preservation techniques
Overview of different food processing methods (thermal processing, freezing, drying, fermentation)
Effects of processing on the nutritional value and quality of food

Food Safety and Sanitation:
Importance of food safety and sanitation in the food industry Principles of foodborne illness prevention and control
Good manufacturing practices and Hazard Analysis Critical Control Point principles

Food Quality and Sensory Evaluation:
Factors affecting food quality (appearance, taste, texture, aroma) Sensory evaluation techniques for assessing food quality Quality control and assurance in the food industry

Food and Society:
Social, cultural, and economic aspects of food
Food sustainability and environmental considerations

Food Product Development and Innovation:
Introduction to food product development process
Consumer preferences and market research in product development Food product labeling and packaging considerations

Food Product Labeling and Regulations: Understanding food labeling regulations and requirements Interpretation of nutrition facts labels and ingredient lists
Claims and certifications on food packaging (organic, gluten-free, non- GMO)
Consumer rights and protection regarding food labeling and advertising

Food and Human Nutrition:
Basic principles of human nutrition
Nutritional requirements and guidelines for different age groups and populations
Relationship between diet and health

Emerging Trends in Food Sciences and Nutrition:
Exploration of current and emerging topics in the field
Discussion of advancements in food technology, functional foods, and nutraceuticals
Future directions and opportunities in food sciences and nutrition
